body:
You mostly like have routes set for the same path twice, once using the `{controller}` and another using `:controller`.

In 3.9 the fallback routes were update to use the new style placeholders using curly braces.

This is a patch release on 3.8 though (3.8.7 introduced this). I wouldnt expect this to happen here.
I will double check the setup of routes.
I can fix up the tests ( https://github.com/dereuromark/cakephp-tools/pull/254/commits/4abee20c6c33807ecb498c24d6701bd568b6bd71 )

@dereuromark if there was no controller parameter in the request context then there isn't anything to replace. I think it would be better to raise an error when required placeholders have not been replaced though.

I am going to add an error for that situation as I don't think the behavior <3.8.6 was right either.
It seems to only be an issue for fake requests, so in tests.

issue.title: Fix optional routing keys with braced placeholders

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Optional parameters were not working correctly with braced parameters. While non-core parameters can be optional the controller + action parameters should never be null as that will result in invalid URLs generated or incorrect results that only contain the action parameter.

I've removed a few invalid test cases that were providing keys as both in the template and as a default. This has not worked for a long time and these tests were relying on the now invalid behavior.

Fixes #13997

body: Pull request up now to make optional parameters work with brace placeholders and make controller & action required keys when they are in the route template.
